newsitem.title: UK: Global Ocean Carriers notes to be priced Thursday.
newsitem.headline: Global Ocean Carriers notes to be priced Thursday.

text.p: New York-listed shipping group Global Ocean Carriers Ltd said that its $125 million issue of senior notes will be priced today (Thursday).
Speaking at a London investors' roadshow Global Ocean executive vice president Michael Jolliffe said the bond issue will be priced during the afternoon local time in New York.

The issue was increased to $125 million from $100 million overnight, Jolliffe said, after the company decided not to enter into a $50 million secured credit facility at the same time. The 10-year notes will be due 2007.

Moody's Investors Service has upgraded its rating of the offer to B2 from B3 as a result of the changes, and Jolliffe said he had been told that Standard & Poors would also be upgrading its rating, to B plus from B.
Around $55 million of the funds raised by the issue will be used to pay for four additional ships and $61.5 million to pay off existing debts.
Jolliffe said Global Ocean was still hoping to carve out a secured facility of up to $20 million which it would not use immediately but might call on in the next six to nine months.
